definition: Final check for mechanical errors including spelling, punctuation, grammar, and formatting

positive_examples: Proofreading catches typos, missing commas, and subject-verb agreement errors.
Proofreading is the final stage: don't proofread until revision and editing are complete.
Proofreading strategies: reading backward, reading aloud, using spell-check cautiously.
Common proofreading catches: its/it's, their/there/they're, missing words.
training_hints.disambiguation: Catching surface mechanical errors, not improving content or style
